trans-unit.source: Asynchronously runs one workflow from another.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity> first calls the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity.Invoking> code-beside method, if one is specified.
Typically, this method is used to set up incoming parameters for the workflow instance to be invoked.
<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity> then creates and invokes a workflow instance of the specified type, passing the parameters that are provided.
As soon as the workflow is invoked, the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity> finishes immediately.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity"></xref> class using the name of the activity.
The user-defined name of the activity.
Gets the <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> that indicates the newly created workflow instance.
Once the workflow is started the <xref:System.Guid> of the created instance is assigned to the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity.InstanceId%2A> property.
This property is a bindable property.
The instance can be retrieved in the code-beside.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> that indicates the newly created workflow instance.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity.InstanceId"></xref> property.
Occurs before the workflow is invoked.
This event is typically used for setting up workflow invoke parameters.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity.Invoking"></xref> event.
Gets the collection of parameters to bind to.
The parameters in this collection are the parameters required to invoke the child workflow.
This collection can only specify inbound parameters.
Outbound and reference parameters cannot be specified, because the workflow invocation is asynchronous.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowParameterBindingCollection"></xref> that contains the parameter bindings for the workflow being called.
The default is an empty <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowParameterBindingCollection"></xref>.

Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity.ParameterBindingsProperty"></xref> property.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the workflow to be invoked.
The fully-qualified name of the workflow to be invoked.
The default is `null`.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity.TargetWorkflow"></xref> property.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> can be filtered by the workflow.
The type that the workflow must filter.
`true` to throw an error if the specified Type cannot be filtered; otherwise, `false`.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Type"></xref> can be filtered; otherwise, `false`.
type is `null`.
throwonError is `true`.
This indicates that type is a design time type.
type is not the root activity.
Gets a description of the filter being used by the workflow.
The description of the filter being used by the workflow.
